com.southamptoncodedojo.minesweeper

Class MapInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.southamptoncodedojo.minesweeper.MapInstance

  • public class MapInstance
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a single instance of a map (typically used by a single user) This allows interaction with the map (clicking certain coordinates, flagging some, etc.)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MapInstance.State
      The possible states a player can be in

      void hit(Coordinate coordinate)
      Hit/click on a given coordinate If the coordinate contains a mine - the player loses If it has 0 mines surrounding it - the surrounding spaces will also be opened

    • Method Detail

      • hit

        public void hit(Coordinate coordinate)
         throws InvalidCoordinateException
        Hit/click on a given coordinate If the coordinate contains a mine - the player loses If it has 0 mines surrounding it - the surrounding spaces will also be opened
        Parameters:
        coordinate - The coordinate to hit
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException - Thrown if the coordinate is out of bounds for map

      • flag

        public void flag(Coordinate coordinate)
          throws InvalidCoordinateException
        Add a flag on a given coordinate (indicating you think there is a mine there). If there is already a flag there this will do nothing. You can add as many flags as you like on your turn.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException

      • unFlag

        public void unFlag(Coordinate coordinate)
            throws InvalidCoordinateException
        Remove a flag from a given coordinate. If there is no flag there this will do nothing. You can remove as many flags as you like on your turn.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException

      • isFlagged

        public boolean isFlagged(Coordinate coordinate)
                  throws InvalidCoordinateException
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        Returns:
        True if there a flag at the given coordinate
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException

      • getCount

        public int getCount(Coordinate coordinate)
             throws UnknownCountException,
                    InvalidCoordinateException
        Get the number of mines surrounding the given coordinate.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        Returns:
        The number of mines surrounding the given coordinate.
        Throws:
        UnknownCountException - This will be thrown if the coordinate has not been opened yet
        InvalidCoordinateException

      • getRemainingCoordinates

        public int getRemainingCoordinates()
        Get the number of spaces which have not yet been opened and do not contain mines. This will be 0 when the map has been won.
        Returns:
        Get the number of spaces which have not yet been opened and do not contain mines.

      • getState

        public MapInstance.State getState()
        Returns:
        The state of the map, WIN/LOSE/InProgress

      • mineIsAt

        public boolean mineIsAt(Coordinate coordinate)
                 throws InvalidCoordinateException
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        Returns:
        True if there is a mine at the given coordinate
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        The size of the map

      • lastHit

        public Coordinate lastHit()
        Which coordinate was last clicked on? This only counts coordinates actually chosen by returning them from the takeTurn() method. It does not include coordinates which have been opened automatically due to cascading zeros.
        Returns:

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen(Coordinate coordinate)
               throws InvalidCoordinateException
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        Returns:
        Has the given coordinate been opened?
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException
